snippet: The numbers come on top of complaints about bureaucracy and a lack of transparency in Gov. Chris Christie’s recovery efforts after Hurricane Sandy.
abstract: Administration of New Jersey Gov Chris Christie has distributed only about one quarter of the $1.2 billion awarded by federal government to help state's homeowners and renters recover from Hurricane Sandy; housing advocacy groups have sued the Christie administration in effort to understand how the state awarded the recovery grants, and why so many residents who were promised disaster relief money still have not gotten it.
lead_paragraph: The numbers come on top of complaints about bureaucracy and a lack of transparency in Gov. Chris Christie’s recovery efforts after Hurricane Sandy.

headline.main: Most Federal Storm Aid Still Undistributed in New Jersey
headline.print_headline: Most U.S. Hurricane Aid Still Undistributed in New Jersey
